title: CIWA-Ar for Alcohol Withdrawal
description: Objectifies severity of alcohol withdrawal symptoms and guides treatment decisions

parameters.name: auditory_disturbances
parameters.description: Auditory disturbances (sounds that disturb or frighten)

ranges.interpretation: No or minimal treatment required, monitor regularly
Requires immediate treatment, high risk for delirium tremens

references: Sullivan JT, Sykora K, Schneiderman J, Naranjo CA, Sellers EM. Assessment of alcohol withdrawal: the revised clinical institute withdrawal assessment for alcohol scale (CIWA-Ar). Br J Addict. 1989 Nov;84(11):1353-7.

Mayo-Smith MF, Beecher LH, Fischer TL, Gorelick DA, Guillaume JL, Hill A, et al. Management of alcohol withdrawal delirium. An evidence-based practice guideline. Arch Intern Med. 2004 Jul 12;164(13):1405-12.
Holbrook AM, Crowther R, Lotter A, Cheng C, King D. Meta-analysis of benzodiazepine use in the treatment of acute alcohol withdrawal. CMAJ. 1999 Mar 23;160(6):649-55.
formula: Sum of all 10 component scores: nausea/vomiting + tremor + sweats + anxiety + agitation + tactile + auditory + visual + headache + orientation
notes: Takes less than 5 minutes to complete
Should be assessed every 1-2 hours during active withdrawal
Most effective when used with symptom-triggered treatment protocols
Not suitable for intubated or heavily sedated patients
Scores ≥8 typically warrant consideration of pharmacological treatment
Scores ≥20 indicate high risk for delirium tremens and seizures
Must be used in conjunction with clinical judgment
